Class SPIMI

  • public class SPIMI
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of Single-pass in-memory indexing algorithms for use in an information retrieval system
    Author:
    Stephen Prizio

    • Method Detail

      • spimi

        public java.io.File spimi(java.util.List<Term> terms,
                          int memoryLimit)
        Implementation of the SPIMI algorithm, taking in a list of terms to be indexed and a memory limit (here stimulated by a limit of terms for one chunk)
        Parameters:
        terms - - terms to be indexed
        memoryLimit - - maximum number of terms for one chunk to stimulate a memory limitation

      • spimiInvert

        private java.io.File spimiInvert(java.util.List<Term> terms)
        Java implementation of the SPIMI-Invert algorithm. The hash table implementation in Java already handles previously existing entries, therefore the adding to dictionary and adding to postings lists operations can be done in tandem, simplifying the algorithm. Additionally, each term's postings list is itself a Set which will automatically double its size should its capacity become full, further simplifying the algorithm.
        Parameters:
        terms - - term stream of terms to be added to the dictionary
        Returns:
        file containing an inverted index of the given terms

      • spimiMerge

        private java.io.File spimiMerge(java.util.List<java.io.File> files)
        Merges a list of files containing inverted indices into one file
        Parameters:
        files - - list of files containing inverted indices
        Returns:
        one file containing the master inverted index

      • sortTerms

        private java.util.Set<Term> sortTerms(java.util.Set<Term> terms)
        Sorts all terms in a set
        Parameters:
        terms - - set of unsorted terms
        Returns:
        set of sorted terms

        Returns:
